img.alt: Two different spheres roll down two inclined planes and collide

problem.p: Two inclined planes have the same vertical height \(H\) and make the same angle \(\theta\) with the horizontal. Two small spheres of equal masses are released from rest at the top of the inclined planes. One of the spheres is thin-walled; the other is uniform. Both spheres roll down without slipping and collide inelastically on the horizontal surface and stick together. Find the speed of the spheres immediately after the collision.
